input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Unobserved confounders has a direct effect on education level and salary. Proximity to a college has a direct effect on education level. Education level has a direct effect on salary. Unobserved confounders is unobserved. The overall probability of college degree or higher is 36%. The probability of high school degree or lower and high salary is 12%. The probability of college degree or higher and high salary is 23%. Is the chance of high salary larger when observing college degree or higher?
